title: Hoda Kotb adopts a baby girl to the surprise of most of her ‘Today’ colleagues
text:
February 21 at 11:21 AM Follow @helena_andrews It's a girl! @HodaKotb announces she's adopted a baby https://t.co/UJom0hKR2O pic.twitter.com/QI8DVYo2WB
— TODAY (@TODAYshow) February 21, 2017
Kotb, who was understandably missing from the morning show on Tuesday, called in to break the news with a photo of herself holding the week-old Haley Joy.
“You have a new hair do,” joked Matt Lauer who along with Kathie Lee Gifford were the only “Today” show personalities privy to the news before Kotb’s reveal. Jenna Bush Hager, Carson Daly, Al Roker and Brian Gumbel were all shocked — most to tears.
“That little girl, Haley Joy,” said Kotb, her voice clearly breaking, “is my daughter. I adopted her.”
Later Kotb, who also co-hosts the fourth hour of “Today” with Gifford, called into that program to gush more about the newest addition to her family.
“Can you believe? I have a daughter,” said Kotb.
“I didn’t know that my heart can feel like this,” she added. “With all the love I’ve ever had in my life, and I’ve had the best love … I never ever imagined that I could feel this kind of … it’s like a warm hand on my heart.”
Then Gifford started crying again.
